document.docAuthor: Huang, Junhao, Yoshitake, Hiraku, Zhang, Runzhi & Ito, Motomi
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic Review of the Genus Rhinoncomimus (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Ceutorhynchinae) with description of a new species from Yunnan, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic Review of the Genus Rhinoncomimus (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Ceutorhynchinae) with description of a new species from Yunnan, China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Rhinoncomimus niger Chûjô and Morimoto, 1959 : 287
( type locality: Japan , Sendai, Shimokita).—Yoshitake et al. , 2004 : 105 (in checklist).—Korotyaev, 2004 : 107

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 62–69. Male and female genitalia of
Rhinoncomimus niger
from Guangdong, China. (62–66) Male. (62) Penis, dorsal view. (63) Apex of the penis, dorsal view. (64) Penis, lateral view. (65) Tegmen. (66) Sternites VIII and IX. (67–69) Female. (67) Sternite VIII. (68) Coxite and stylus. (69) Spermatheca. Scale bar: 0.20 mm for 62–67, 0.10 mm for 68–69.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Supplementary description. Male.
LB: 2.30–2.89 (mean, 2.60 ). LR: 0.70–0.82 (mean, 0.76 ). LP: 0.76–0.95 (mean, 0.83 ). N = 13 for all measurements. Male genitalia. Spiculum gastrale (sternite IX; Figs. 58 , 66 ) robust, evidently longer than the penis or its apodeme, bent leftward. Tegmen ( Figs. 57 , 65 ) with apodeme short and robust, nearly 0.3 times as long as the diameter of the tegminal ring, more or less widened toward the apex. Penis (
Figs. 54 –56
,
62– 64
) relatively broad and robust, relatively thick in profile, more or less moderately curved downward in the basal 1 / 3 , then slightly bent upward in the apical 1 / 3 ; sides subparallel in basal half, then gradually convergent apically; apical projection ( Figs. 55 , 63 ,
70, 72, 74, 76, 78
) rounded at apex. Basal part of the endophallus ( Figs. 54 , 62 ) with a pair of large plate-like sclerites in the base, numerous moderately dense minute spicules in the median part, and several smaller plate-like sclerites in apical part.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 70–79. Apex of penis and spermatheca of
Rhinoncomimus niger
from various localities. (70–71) Aomori, Japan. (72–73) Sendai, Japan. (74–75) Kyushu, Japan. (76–77) Hunan, China. (78–79) Guangdong. (70, 72, 74, 76, 78) Apex of penis, dorsal view. (71, 73, 75, 77, 79) Spermatheca. Scale bar: 0.10 mm for 70, 72, 74, 76, 78; 0.20 mm for 71, 73, 75, 77, 79.

Distribution. China (Jiangxi, Hunan, Guangdong, Guizhou— new record ), Japan .
Biological notes. Plant association remains unknown.

Remarks. The species shows similarity to
Rh. klapperichi
,
Rh. continuus
and
Rh. robustus
in external morphology but can be easily differentiated by its black vestiture without white lanceolate scales on the elytra and the mucro developed only on the male mesotibia. The species is quite common in southern China and long series of specimens were examined from various localities in Japan and China . The specimens show considerable variation in external morphology, including length and width of rostrum, shape of elytra, sculpture of intervals and color of different parts of the body; however, no distinct variation was observed in the male and female genitalia of the specimens from northern Japan to southern China (
Figs. 70–79
).
